contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "May we always praise the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: May the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ be praised

contextId.information: The word "crushed" refers to the feeling of despair. This can be stated in active form. AT: "The troubles we experienced completely crushed us" or "We were in complete despair" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: We were completely crushed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the gracious favor which God has given to us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the gracious favor given to us

contextId.information: Paul is speaking about the behavior of certain Corinthian believers who caused him emotional pain. This can be stated in active form. AT: "those who should have made me rejoice might not hurt me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I might not be hurt by those who should have made me rejoice

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. The word "punishment" can be translated using a verb. AT: "The way that the majority has punished that person is enough" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: This punishment of that person by the majority is enough

contextId.information: This means to have a strong emotional response of too much sorrow. This can be stated in active form. AT: "too much sorrow does not overwhelm him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he is not overwhelmed by too much sorrow

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "those whom God has saved" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: those who are saved

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the ones whom God is saving" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the ones being saved

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "as people whom God has sent" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: as we are sent from God

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form with "Christ" as the implied subject. AT: "which Christ has written on our hearts" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: written on our hearts

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "It is not a letter that people wrote with ink but a letter that the Spirit of the living God wrote" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: It was written not with ink but by the Spirit of the living God

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT "the law which God once made glorious" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that which was once made glorious

contextId.information: Here both occurrences of the word "it" refer to "the same veil." This can be stated in active form. AT: "No one removes the veil, because only in Christ does God remove it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It is not opened up, because only in Christ is it done away with

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People afflict us in every way" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: We are afflicted in every way

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People strike us down but do not destroy us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: We are struck down but not destroyed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "other people may see the life of Jesus in our bodies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the life of Jesus also may be shown in our bodies

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "so other people may see the life of Jesus in our bodies." See how you translated this phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:2co:04:07|4:10]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so that the life of Jesus may be shown in our human bodies

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "as the one who wrote these words" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: according to that which was written

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "as God spreads his grace to many people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: as grace is spread to many people

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God is renewing our inward being more each day" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: inwardly we are being renewed day by day

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "things that we can see ... things that we cannot see" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: things that are seen ... things that are unseen

contextId.information: This refers to the "building from God." This can be stated in active form. AT: "It is a house that humans have not made" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: It is a house not made by human hands

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "we will not be naked" or "God will not find us naked" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: we will not be found to be naked

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the things he has done in the physical body" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the things done in the body

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "as if people did not know us and yet people still know us well" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: as if we were unknown and we are still well known

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "We work as if people are punishing us for our actions but not as if they have condemned us to death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: We work as being punished for our actions but not as condemned to death

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "We have not restrained your hearts" or "We have not given you any reason to stop loving us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Your hearts are not restrained by us

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "set yourselves apart" or "allow me to set you apart" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: be set apart

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "we experienced trouble in every way" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: we were troubled in every way

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "not because what I said in my letter distressed you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: not because you were distressed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that someone should carry out justice" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that justice should be done

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "so that you would know that your earnestness for us is sincere" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so that your earnestness for us should be made known to you

contextId.information: Here the word "this" refers to the way the Corinthians responded to Paul's previous letter, as he described in the previous verse. This can be stated in active form. AT: "This is what encourages us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It is by this that we are encouraged

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the grace that God has given to the churches of Macedonia" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the grace of God that has been given to the churches of Macedonia

contextId.information: Here Paul quotes from Exodus. This can be stated in active form. AT: "as Moses wrote" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: as it is written

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the brother whom believers among all of the churches praise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the brother who is praised among all of the churches

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the churches also selected him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he also was selected by the churches

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the churches have sent them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they are sent by the churches

contextId.information: "This is just as it is written." This can be stated in active form. AT: "This is just as the writer wrote" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It is as it is written

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Because this service has tested and proven you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Because of your being tested and proved by this service

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom the Lord approves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who is approved

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that people will think that they are like us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they are found to be doing the same work that we are doing

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The Lord does not condone what I am saying about this boastful confidence" or "The Lord has not told me that he approves of what I am saying about this boastful confidence" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: What I am saying about this boastful confidence is not condoned by the Lord

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "people beat me with wooden rods" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I was beaten with rods

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "some people put me in a basket and lowered me to the ground" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I was lowered in a basket

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "it is praise that you should have given me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I should have been praised by you

contextId.information: This can be stated as active. AT: "Believe that someone has done something wrong only after two or three people have said the same thing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Every accusation must be established by the evidence of two or three witnesses

contextId.information: This can be made active. AT: "they crucified him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he was crucified
